column3: concept ACK (with apologies to @paveljanik!)\n\nIf we can find a more intelligent way of managing these warnings so they're not as annoying, I'm all for it. At the moment it feels like the Wshadow tail is wagging the dog.

utACK 2c83911

This was clearly the wrong way to prevent variable name shadows.

> If we can find a more intelligent way of managing these warnings so they're not as annoying, I'm all for it. At the moment it feels like the Wshadow tail is wagging the dog.

> This was clearly the wrong way to prevent variable name shadows.

Agreed. And there is still value in compiling with Wshadow periodically (with a carefully chosen compiler) and seeing if it finds any bug.

Postmerge ACK. The real problem is that people use ancient compilers and I have not tested them all (only few selected by some distros as their default compilers).\n\nFWIW: I'll compile all my builds with `-Wshadow` to catch all new occurrences. And of course, thanks for patience :-)
